conclusion: Analyze the graph for changes in velocity over time to determine variable linear motion.
The v-t graph shows velocity as a function of time with velocity in m/s and time in seconds.
From t=0 to t=1 second, velocity is constant at 2 m/s.
From t=1 to t=3 seconds, velocity decreases linearly from 2 m/s to -2 m/s.
In the first second, velocity is constant, indicating uniform linear motion.
At t=1 second, velocity starts to change, indicating transition to variable linear motion.
From t=1 to t=3 seconds, velocity changes linearly, representing accelerated motion.
The particle undergoes uniform linear motion for the first second and non-uniform motion after t=1 second.
The particle was undergoing variable linear motion in the first 3 seconds.
Final Answer: Yes, the particle underwent variable linear motion in the first 3 seconds.
